Note: 
This game contains multiple unlockable paths - don't stop playing at the first credits roll!

The best-rated paid Oculus Quest App as of January 2021 according to Road to VR!
Won the Adventure Category Award for the Famitsu/Dengeki 2020 Game Awards!
*Famitsu is the most prestigious video game magazine starting in 1986 in Japan

"I found myself completely immersed in ALTDEUS' story…"
GREAT★★★★ – UploadVR

Dive 300 years into the future of Tokyo. Altdeus: Beyond Chronos is a sci-fi adventure full of robot battles, pop music, and emotion. It features 15-20 hours of gameplay with one of the largest branching storylines ever in a VR game. 
Become Chloe, a mecha pilot who will have her revenge and annihilate the Meteora once and for all. Pilot a giant mecha and make the decisions to determine humanity’s future. Explore new choices to uncover new branches of the story and discover all of ALTDEUS’ endings!

Discover the truth, destroy the enemy, and enjoy the cyberspace pop concerts!

nodes.title: ALTDEUS: Beyond Chronos has received over 800 reviews on the Oculus Quest Store
nodes.body_text:
Hello, this is the MyDearest team.

As you can see, ALTDEUS: Beyond Chronos has received over 800 reviews on the Oculus Quest Store.

Thank you for your playing and reviewing the game.

We’d appreciate it if you review it when you have time if you haven’t done it yet.

As we announced last week, we’re planning to release its new DLC, ALTDEUS: Beyond Chronos EPISODE YAMATO, in early June. The story will feature Yamato Amanagi, a member of Prometheus and pilot of the Ares Makhia who appeared in the main story.

We hope you’ll still enjoy the ALTDEUS: Beyond Chronos world.

Thank you for your continued support.

Best regards,

The MyDearest Team

nodes.title: ALTDEUS: Beyond Chronos Launches DLC On Oculus Quest In Early June
nodes.body_text:
Hello, this is the MyDearest team.

As we announced at the live stream event on May 14 in Japan, we’ll release a new DLC of ALTDEUS: Beyond Chronos, ALTDEUS: Beyond Chronos EPISODE YAMATO, in early June.

In the new DLC, ALTDEUS: Beyond Chronos EPISODE YAMATO, you will play as Second Lieutenant Yamato Amanagi, a member of Prometheus and pilot of the Ares Makhia. Chloe tries to escape from Prometheus with Anima, but Yamato stands in her way carrying the hopes of his comrades - to bring her back or die trying.

The Swordstrike system, the awesome power of Ares Makhia's sword, will provide you with new interactive experiences, taking approximately 2 hours to complete all of the story branches.

It will be available for Oculus Quest / Oculus Quest 2 in early June for $9.99 featuring English and Japanese voice acting and Chinese (Simplified), and French subtitles.

We hope you’re excited to hear this news and you’ll enjoy the DLC.

Best regards,

The MyDearest Team

こんにちは！アルトデウスBC開発チームです！
この度はアルトデウスをプレイ頂きありがとうございます！

5月14日（金）の21時より行われたアルトデウスBC新規プロジェクト発表配信イベントにて発表された通り、6月上旬にDLC『アルトデウス：BC エピソード ヤマト』を発売することになりました！

タイトル通り今回は、クロエ（CV.鬼頭明里）と同じ対メテオラ用人型都市防衛兵器「マキア」のパイロットで本編にも登場した、ヤマト・アマナギ（CV.小林裕介）が主人公の新エピソードとなり、皆さまにはヤマト視点でゲームをプレイして頂きます！

DCLの価格は990円（税込）で、Oculus Quest、Oculus Quest2での先行配信となります！
アルトデウスBC本編をご購入頂いた方のみが購入可能となります！

具体的な発売日は決まり次第改めてお知らせ致します！

発売まであと少しですが、皆さまに最高の作品をお届けすべく開発チーム一同ラストスパートをかけて制作に励んでおりますので、もう少々お待ち下さい！

アルトデウス開発チーム一同より

node.reviewDescription:
I played only with english audio and turned the subtitles off. I noticed a different cast member count between Japanese vs English? Is there material missing from the English version? The writing and the voices and sound is very good.
Btw, I'm not a big VN player. But because of this I wished it would have had a setting to abandon the VN style animation and do more a real full anime type animation style as an option. The mecha piloting is all on rails as expected with a VN. The mini game is like pressing buttons at the right time to advance the battle to a specific outcome. But this is not a mecha simulator.
The story and different arcs and endings are all engaging. The fun is to find these by going back and trying different dialog options or other choices. When trying to find a new arc most things can be skipped easily, but I had to watch somethings over and over again that should have been skippable as well. For example the ending credits or some battle animation.
I did reach 100% of all the achievements and that took probably 15 to 20 hours. If you get the game, and you see the credits for the fist time it's not over, actually it's just getting interesting...
